intro: Xerobotrys tomentosus, commonly known as the woolly xerobotrys, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive, soft appearance. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
